newsArray.title: RCB Announces Full Ticket Refunds For Cancelled IPL 2025 Home Matches Against SRH & KKR
creator: ABP Live Sports
newsArray.description: Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) have confirmed ticket refunds for their two home matches of the Indian Premier League (IPL) 2025 against Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) and Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR), which were originally scheduled for May 13 and May 17 at the M. Chinnaswamy Stadium. Notably, the IPL 2025 was suspended midway amid rising cross-border tensions between India and Pakistan. Match no. 58 of IPL 2025 between Punjab Kings (PBKS) and Delhi Capitals (DC) was interrupted midway, with the BCCI announcing a suspension of the tournament for at least a week just hours later.ALSO ON ABP Live | BCCI Shortlists Three Southern India Cities To Host Remaining IPL 2025 Matches: ReportRCB announced on X that ticket holders for their May 13 and 17 home matches are eligible for full refunds. Physical ticket holders must retain their tickets, while digital ticket holders will receive refund details via email or phone."Original Ticket holders of #RCBvSRH and #RCBvKKR at the Chinnaswamy stadium, originally scheduled on the 13th and 17th of May 2025, are eligible for a full refund, subject to terms and conditions. Physical ticket holders are required to keep their tickets handy. Digital ticket holders will receive all the necessary details via your registered email and/or phone number soon."üö® Tickets Refund Update: #RCBvSRH and #RCBvKKRüö®Original Ticket holders of #RCBvSRH and #RCBvKKRat the Chinnaswamy stadium, originally scheduled on the 13th and 17th of May 2025, are eligible for a full refund, subject to terms and‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/TlffO1r0ks‚Äî Royal Challengers Bengaluru (@RCBTweets) May 10, 2025ALSO READ | India-Pakistan Ceasefire: BCCI Contemplating IPL 2025 Resumption; Check Details InsideWhile initially the IPL 2025 was announced to have been suspended for at least a week, the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) is contemplating the resumption of the cash-rich league after both India and Pakistan agreed to a ceasefire on May 10 (Saturday), as per sources.While official updates from the BCCI are still pending, sources informed ABP News that the board is considering making a decision on the resumption of IPL 2025 on May 11 (Sunday).

newsArray.description: A rare first in the world of T20 cricket, as UAE figured out a way to circumvent the lack of a declaration in T20 cricket in an effort to buy time vs Qatar.
